# Question

Write a function `clean_column` that cleans a column name (`col`) by lowercasing it, stripping any leading or trailing whitespaces, and replacing any spaces and hyphens with an underscore, eg, "My Column" becomes "my_column".

Here is the code for your `clean_column` function:

```julia
function clean_column(col::String)
    return replace(lowercase(strip(col)), r"[\s-]" => "_")
end
```
This function first converts the string to lowercase using `lowercase`, then removes leading and trailing whitespaces with `strip`. It uses `replace` function to replace all spaces and hyphens in the string with underscores. This can be achieved by passing a regular expression (`r"[\s-]"`) that matches either a whitespace or a hyphen as the first argument of `replace`. The second argument is what to replace matched characters with (in this case, an underscore).
